intro: Pleurothallis tentaculata, commonly known as the tentacle orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), providing structural support for its climbing habit. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
